titleStmt.title: Peace triumphant., or, A congratulatory poem To celebrate the unspeakable benefits and blessings of peace, together with some grateful reflections upon King William the III. His excellent Majesties first coming to the crown, as a happy instrument in the hand of divine providence, to settle the affairs of the nation, and with the hazard of his own life to deliver us from near approaching ruine / written by Tho. Cheeseman.
titleStmt.author: Cheesman, Thomas.

titleStmt.title: Peace triumphant., or, A congratulatory poem To celebrate the unspeakable benefits and blessings of peace, together with some grateful reflections upon King William the III. His excellent Majesties first coming to the crown, as a happy instrument in the hand of divine providence, to settle the affairs of the nation, and with the hazard of his own life to deliver us from near approaching ruine / written by Tho. Cheeseman.
titleStmt.author: Cheesman, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Parkhurst, at the Bible and Three Crowns in Cheap-Side,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
